references.paper_title: Vectornet: Encoding hd maps and agent dynamics from vectorized representation
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel vectorized representation for encoding HD maps and agent dynamics, significantly influencing the field of motion forecasting and becoming a foundational work for many subsequent studies.

This foundational paper introduced the Transformer architecture, which has been widely adopted in various sequence-to-sequence tasks, including motion forecasting, due to its ability to model long-range dependencies and capture intricate relationships within sequences.

references.paper_title: HDGT: Heterogeneous driving graph transformer for multi-agent trajectory prediction via scene encoding
references.reason: This work leverages the transformer architecture to model detailed relationships within the overall scene for multi-agent trajectory prediction, contributing significantly to advancing the state-of-the-art in this complex task.

references.paper_title: Forecast-mae: Self-supervised pre-training for motion forecasting with masked autoencoders
references.reason: This paper introduces a self-supervised pre-training approach for motion forecasting using masked autoencoders, achieving improved performance compared to previous methods and setting a new standard for model training in this area.

This work introduces a query-centric design for motion forecasting, which is efficient and effective for modeling interactions among agents, providing a novel architectural approach that has influenced other works in the area.
